definition: point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items
to push aside with the hand, foot, a stick etc/to dial/to allocate/to set aside (money)/to poke (the fire)/to pluck (a string instrument)/to turn round/classifier: group, batch

sentences.english: Progress of a student should be largely attributed to his teachers' direction and enlightenment.
sentences.chinese: 孩子一點一滴的進步主要來自於老師們的指導和點撥。

sentences.english: On little details he would be on top of you.
sentences.chinese: 他會在小細節上提醒點撥你。

sentences.english: She need to be pointed out mistakes so that they can be corrected.
sentences.chinese: 中國需要別人的點撥，這樣中國就能不斷修正。

sentences.english: The beauty bosom friend is a kind of point to stir, ordering to stir your wrong path in the heart.
sentences.chinese: 紅顏知己就是一種點撥，點撥你心中的迷津。

sentences.english: The beauty bosom friend is a kind of point to stir, ordering to stir your wrong path in the heart.
sentences.chinese: 紅顏知己就是一種點撥，點撥你心中的迷津。

sentences.english: As you are so modest, I am honored to teach you.
sentences.chinese: 看你如此謙遜，那我就榮幸地點撥你一回。

definition: lit. to have accumulated knowledge and deliver it slowly (idiom)/good preparation is the key to success/to be well prepared
to master the subject via a comprehensive study of surrounding areas
scholarship/high-level study/to do scholarly research/to pursue a high level of study
handling a butcher's cleaver with ease (idiom); to do sth skillfully and easily
pragmatic/flexible/to act differently in different situations/to accommodate to circumstances
to read and re-read sth until one is familiar with it
when you teach someone, both teacher and student will benefit
see 承前啟後|承前启后[cheng2 qian2 qi3 hou4]
